title: langlee-coronavirus-pcr-test-site-depriving-residents
story: THE Bordersrsquo site for PCR coronavirus tests is lsquodeprivingrsquo residents of a vital community hub, a meeting has heard.The walk-through test site at Langlee Community Centre is operated by the UK Governmentrsquos Department of Health and Social Care.During a full council meeting last week, Galashiels councillor Harry Scott asked the council whether it would find a dferent site for the testing station after receiving concerns from a community group.Mr Scott said that the continued use of the centre by the NHS is ldquodenying the use of the large hall and cafeacute to the groups who normally use those facilities.:Peebles woman was found with large quantity of cocaine worth more than pound,Selkirkshire councillor Gordon Edgar ndash the councilrsquos executive member for infrastructure, travel and transport ndash said that the site has ldquohigh usage.ldquoThe UK Government has asked that the PCR test sites remain operational until March , he said. ldquoThe current lease expires in January .ldquoThe Langlee site is the only PCR site in the Borders. It has a high usage which is anticipated to increase over the winter period.ldquoIt is in a relatively central location within the most populated Borders locality. Five groups were displaced from Langlee, all five groups were offered alternative provision.Responding, Mr Scott, an independent representative, said: ldquoI appreciate the need to support the NHS in the early stages of this horrible pandemic but things have moved on now.ldquoThe other side of the coin is this centre in Langlee is in the middle of one of the areas that houses some of the poorest and socially deprived iniduals in the Borders.ldquoThis centre is vital in the maintenance of their mental health and wellbeing.:Man stole money from Borders busker after throwing bottle at wall, say policeldquoI donrsquot think itrsquos acceptable that this Langlee community is deprived of this centre for any longer than is necessary..removeAccording to Mr Scott, he has received correspondence from NHS Scotland stating that the ldquorequired facilities for a testing station are not overly prescriptive.Mr Edgar said that Scottish Borders Council officers are ldquoactively engaged in finding alternative sites.However, the independent councillor said that the requirements of any potential new site ndash including the need for safe queuing, separate entry and exit routes and sufficient toilet facilities ndash is making this dficult.He said that the old school buildings at council headquarters had been looked at but were discounted due to space and accessibility issues.Mr Edgar added that empty retail units in Galashiels had also been considered.PCR tests can also be accessed through mobile testing units and home test kits, according to NHS Borders.

title: galashiels-former-borders-college-campus-plans-revealed
story: PLANS for the former Borders College campus in Galashiels have been revealed.Eildon Housing has acquired the ldquokey site as part of plans to provide ldquomuch-needed high quality affordable rented homes.Nile Istephan, CEO of Eildon Housing, says the housing association is working closely with the council to produce a ldquodetailed proposal for the site.:Man stole money from Borders busker after throwing bottle at wall, say policeldquoWe have acquired the site of the former Borders College, on Melrose Road, Galashiels which has been lying vacant for many years now, he said. ldquoThis site offers a great opportunity for Eildon to provide much needed affordable homes to rent in a popular, central area of the town.Mr Istephan added: ldquoThis is a signicant regeneration site, and we will be able to provide a range of housing options to meet known local needs, as well helping the Borders meet sustainability and climate change targets. Our investment also generates high quality local training and employment opportunities.The former campus plans form a part of Eildonrsquos ldquorecord-breaking expansion of housing and care services in the Borders.Building work may not start until the summer of , according to the housing association.

title: votes-counted-old-bexley-sidcup-by-election
story: The Tories appear on course for victory in the Old Bexley and Sidcup by-election, but only a third of those eligible to vote took part.The Conservatives expect to retain the constituency, which was held by former Cabinet minister James Brokenshire until his death in October, despite a bruising few weeks for Boris Johnsonrsquos administration.The contest is taking place following damaging headlines over allegations of sleaze, claims that lockdown rules were broken in No  and the emergence of the Omicron coronavirus iant.vw,vw,px, px"Election staff sort ballot papers during the count for the Old Bexley and Sidcup by-election Local Tory councillor Louie French is the bookmakersrsquo firm favourite to win the election, with Labour acknowledging that they did not expect an upset.Mr Brokenshire held the south-east London seat with a majority of almost , at the  general election, taking .% of the vote.A string of senior Tories, including the Prime Minister, have visited the constituency during the by-election campaign, with Transport Secretary Grant Shapps among the MPs bolstering the effort to get out the vote on Thursday.But a turnout of just % ndash , votes ndash suggests the by-election contest has failed to excite the public in the constituency.Labour also had a high-profile on the streets of Old Bexley and Sidcup, with shadow chancellor Rachel Reeves and her sister and shadow solicitor general Ellie among those knocking on doors on polling day on behalf of candidate Daniel Francis.Labour sisters on the doorstep##VoteLabourpic AAJrbDeBjmdash Ellie ReevesDecember , Labour were second in , with .% of the vote and will hope to make inroads into the Tory vote share.After polls closed, Ellie Reeves said: ldquoThis seat has always been a safe Tory seat and we donrsquot expect that to change tonight.ldquoHowever, people are increasingly fed up of the Prime Ministerrsquos broken promises ndash on tax rises, social care and NHS waiting lists. Patience is wearing thin with Boris Johnson..removeldquoWersquove run a positive campaign and people have been open to hearing Labourrsquos offer, but to win this was never within reach for us.Senior Tory Justin Tomlinson suggested Labour should be running the Conservatives ldquovery, very close in seats like Old Bexley and Sidcupthe party is to be viewed as a serious alternative government but ldquothat is not a feeling that we were getting on the doorsteps during this month.He added that ldquoover %, mid-forties would be a good share of the vote for the Conservatives.Other candidates include Simone Reynolds for the Lib Dems, Jonathan Rooks for the Greens, and Reform Party leader Richard Tice.The constituency has been held by the Conservatives since its inception in , and in its previous incarnations since the s, with former prime minister Edward Heath among those to represent it..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Votes being counted in Old Bexley and Sidcup by-election

title: tories-win-old-bexley-sidcup-by-election-reduced-majority
story: Tory Louie French has become the UKrsquos newest MP following the Old Bexley and Sidcup by-election.Mr French took more than half the votes in the contest, which was triggered by the death of former Cabinet minister James Brokenshire.Turnout in the contest was just %, meaning the Tory majority was slashed from the almost , that Mr Brokenshire had in .Huge thanks to voters in Old Bexley  Sidcup. A massive result for @reformparty_uk, coming rd with almost as many votes as the Lib Dems  Greens combined. Now only  parties to choose from in British politics and Reform UK is the only one on the upward march.mdash Richard TiceDecember , Mr French had a , vote cushion over Labour, with Sir Keir Starmerrsquos partyrsquos share of the vote increasing from .Reform leader Richard Tice came in third, claiming his party was now ldquoon the upward march.Mr French used his acceptance speech to pay tribute to his ldquogood friendMr Brokenshire, who died from lung cancer in October.He said: ldquoThis has been a tough contest, which has been fought with dignity and respect.The by-election took place against a dficult backdrop for the Tories, after weeks of allegations about sleaze, Boris Johnsonrsquos chaotic speech to the Confederation of British Industry, claims that lockdown rules were broken in No  last Christmas and the imposition of coronavirus restrictions following the emergence of the Omicron stage.But Mr French insisted it was local issues which dominated the campaign.ldquoMy focus will now be delivering on those promises that I made during the campaign ndash get our fair share of Londonrsquos police officers, securing more investment for local schools and hospitals, protecting our precious green spaces.He promised voters he would ldquowork tirelessly to repay the trust that yoursquove placed in me and I will not let you down.vw,vw,px, px"Louie French celebrates victory in the Old Bexley and Sidcup by-election .removeMr French, a local councillor, said: ldquoThis is the greatest honour of my le. And I hope it inspires people to achieve their own dreams.Labourrsquos Daniel Francis secured , votes, almost % of the total, up from the .% the party received in .The Tory vote share decreased ndash Mr Brokenshire had .% in , Mr French had .% ndash and Labour pointed to a % swing in their favour.Shadow solicitor general Ellie Reeves told the PA news agency: ldquoWersquore pleased with the result tonight.ldquoThis is a Conservative stronghold, somewhere that had a , majority at the last general election and what wersquove seen tonight is that majority being slashed. Therersquos been a % swing over to Labour this evening.ldquoWersquove been knocking on doors for weeks here and finding many, many Conservative voters that have said actually Irsquom not going to vote for them this time, Irsquom going to vote for Labour.ldquoI think itrsquos clear that wersquore winning back the trust of people and itrsquos a remarkable result for us in a Tory stronghold..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Tories win Old Bexley and Sidcup by-election with reduced majority

title: three-parties-claim-massive-result-old-bexley-sidcup-by-election
story: The Conservatives, Labour and Reform UK have all hailed their results at the Old Bexley and Sidcup by-election as a signicant achevement.The Conservatives said Louie Frenchrsquos victory was ldquoalmost unheard of for a sitting Government.The party secured % of the vote on a much reduced turnout at Thursdayrsquos by-election, held following the death of James Brokenshire in October.vw,vw,px, px"Justin Tomlinson was all smiles following the by-election Tory deputy chairman Justin Tomlinson said: ldquoWersquore absolutely thrilled. For a Government to get over % of the vote in a parliamentary by-election is almost unheard of, and with a majority of over %.ldquoA fantastic local candidate, positive campaign, focused on the tangible dference wersquore making to peoplersquos lives, having navigated the unprecedented challenges of Covid.The winning candidate, a local councillor who wore Mr Brokenshirersquos rosette on election night as a mark of respect for his predecessor, said the people of Old Bexley and Sidcup had sent ldquoa clear message: they want an MP who will work with the Government to deliver on their priorities.He added: ldquoMy focus will now be delivering on those promises that I made during the campaign ndash get our fair share of Londonrsquos police officers, securing more investment for local schools and hospitals, protecting our precious green spaces.Mr Tomlinson also said it was ldquoan absolute disaster for Labour, adding: ldquoTheir deal that theyrsquove done with the Liberal Democrats to concentrate on this one and the Liberal Democrats to concentrate on Shropshire has massively backfired for the Labour Party. Itrsquos yet another disastrous parliamentary by-election for them.But the Labour Party sounded an upbeat note despite their loss, pointing to a % swing from the Conservatives to Labour and their .% share of the vote ndash the partyrsquos highest share in the seat for  years..removeEllie Reeves, MP for Lewisham West and Penge, said: ldquoWersquore pleased with the result tonight.ldquoThis is a Conservative stronghold, somewhere that had a , majority at the last general election and what wersquove seen tonight is that majority being slashed. title: cold-weather-payments-postcode-checker---eligible
story: Cold weather often means your bills increase as you turnthe heating on to counter the icy temperatures - but did you know you couldbe eligible fora pay out to help with this Snow and ice are forecast for areas of Scotlandin the coming days, meaning more wintery temperatures could be on their way.With that in mind, heres everything you need to know about who is eligible and how to checkyour postcode should receive a pay out...What are Cold Weather Payments The Cold Weather Payments are available the average temperature in your area is recorded as, or forecast to be, zero degrees celsius or below over  days in a row.You canget pound for each  day period of very cold weather betweenNovember   and March  .Who is eligible for the Cold Weather Payments To receivethe cold weather payments, you must be receiving certain benefits.You may get Cold Weather Paymentsyoursquore getting:Pension CreditIncome Supportincome-based Jobseekerrsquos Allowanceincome-related Employment and Support AllowanceUniversal CreditSupport for Mortgage InterestAdditionally, you must meet at least one of the following criteria:Be in receipt of a disability or pension premiumHave a child under five living with youBe in receipt of Child Tax Credit that includes a disability or severe disability elementHave a healthcondition or disability and have limited capability for workBe in the work-related activity group or support groupHave a severe or enhanced disability premium.Have a disabled child in the household ndashyou are receiving Universal Credit then you will receive a CWP where this applies, whether you are working or notDo I need toapply for Cold Weather Payments No -you are eligible for the Cold Weather Payments you will be automatically paid and do not need to apply.However,you think you should have received a payment but havent, you should tell thePension ServiceorJobcentre Plus..removeAlternatively, you should add a note to your Universal Credit online journal orring the Universal Credit helpline.How can I check my postcode for the Cold Weather Payments You can check your postcode for the Cold Weather Payments on the governments postcode checker which can be found here.Simply enter your postcode to find out how many payments your area is eligible for betweenNovember   and March .Payments are only available when there has been -days in a row of temperatures or forecast temperatures below  degrees.

title: national-whisky-festival-edinburgh---get-tickets
story: The winter edition of the National Whisky Festival of Scotlandheads to Edinburgh next week - and tickets are still available!Lots of expert distillers will be on hand offering tasters of both well known and newer brands.You can also sign up to masterclasses in tasting and pairing, which are suitable for whisky experts and debutees alike.Heres everything you need to know about the event...When is the National Whisky Festival of Scotland The National Whisky Festival of Scotland will take place on Saturday December  at Summerhall in Edinburgh.Two sessions are available - session  is at pm and session  at :pm.Two dferent masterclasses will also take place:Whisky  Sherry: A spiritual pairing class with SMWS - Session One: - pm and Session Two:pm - :pmAround the worldwith Whisky - Session Two :pm - :pmHow much are tickets There are two dferent tickets prices:Standard ticket: pound.Under s: pound.Access is limited to those aged +.What does you ticket include Entry to one National Whisky Festival Session Unique lsquoNational Whisky Festival Of Scotlandrsquo branded Glencairn crystal nosing glass, to use on the day and take homeAccess to sampling an extensive range of dferent whiskiesThe official festival programmeDiscount vouchers to be used at onsite festival bottle shop - run by specialist retailers.Access to masterclasses within your session Live musicWhich brands will be on offer Black BottleChocolate TreeDeanstonThe DalmoreDouglas LaingEden MillElixir DistillersFettercairnFIODHFrasier LiqueurThe Glasgow Distillery Co.GlencadamGlen ScotiaJuraLindores AbbeyLoch LomondMackmyraOld BallantruanSMWSSPEYStarwardStauningSugar House RumTomintoulThe Philosophy of Whisky - Billy AbbottWee SmokyWolfburn

title: minato-sushi-cheese-lady-boost-haddington-town-centre
story: The Cheese Lady on Haddington High Street is moving into the former butcher premises of Colin D Peat on neighbouring Court Street.The move from High Street has opened the door for Minato Sushi to bring the Japanese delicacy to the town centre.The changing face of the town centre was welcomed by councillors Tom Trotter and John McMillan, with the new businesses set to open this summer.Jen Kerr, of Minato Sushi, stressed there was still plenty of work ahead at the business before the doors opened.The -year-old, of Port Seton, who will run the business with her boyfriend Tom Cuddy, described it as ldquoa real dream come true.She said: ldquoWe are really excited. It is quite a big town centre in East Lothian and has quite a erse mix of businesses there already. It seems nice and some people have been coming up and chatting to me and other shop owners have been quite friendly.Meanwhile, Svetlana Kukharchuk ndash The Cheese Lady ndash has ambitious plans for the former butchers having found a home for her business in the town nearly four years ago.She said: ldquoWe needed more space and wanted to expand so we can offer more space to our customers to shop more conveniently.ldquoWe want to mature our own cheeses and we are going to have a maturation room.ldquoAlso, Irsquom hoping to offer a few tables, which still needs to be confirmed with the council, where people can sit down and order a flight of cheese and a glass of wine.Svetlana, who previously had a business in St Andrews, moved to East Lothian in November  and opened her High Street shop.The business has proven a popular addition to the town centre, offering cheeses from throughout Europe, including Italy, France, Spain, Switzerland and Norway.Mr Trotter was pleased with the announcement regarding the two businesses.He said: ldquoWhoever thought a cheese shop in Haddington that, after this time, needed bigger premises  Thatrsquos fantastic.ldquoAnd it is incredible we are getting a sushi shop.Fellow ward member Mr McMillan was pleased with the level of interest from people looking to open up businesses in the town.He said: ldquoI think we are in a good place.ldquoWhen we were growing up, we did not know what sushi was!

title: youngsters-12-hour-non-stop-relay-boosts-walk-scott-foundation
story: Mary Kidd spent a day running, cycling, skipping and more in aid of the Walk With Scott Foundation.The -hour non-stop relay on May  has collected more than pound,, which will go to the Tranent-based charity.Proud mum Karen is secretary of the Walk With Scott Foundation, which was set up by after-dinner speaker Scott Glynn to mark his th birthday.Karen thanked everyone who sponsored her -year-old daughter, who also undertook a fundraiser for the charity last year during lockdown.Karen said: ldquoWe are all so very proud of Mary once again, with her amazingly crazy two fundraising events.ldquoMary has raised a fantastic pound, for the Walk with Scott Foundation and I know first-hand how much these funds are going to help others across our communities.Last year, the primary six pupil at Cockenzie Primary School completed a six-hour TikTok marathon, which raised pound, for the Walk With Scott Foundation.: Familys television appearanceThe success of the fundraiser even caught the attention of former Spandau Ballet and EastEnders star Martin Kemp and his son Roman. Mary and Karen were joined by dad Gordon and older sister Abbie on Martin and Romanrsquos Sunday Best TV show to discuss the success of the event.However, Mary was not content to put her feet up and was once again doing her bit for the good cause.Speaking ahead of the latest fundraiser, Mary said: ldquoThis year I want to double the time, and plan to do a -hour non-stop fun relay up and down our Lorimer Lane at the back of my house.ldquoIrsquom walking, running, skipping, hopping, jumping, scootering, cycling, skating, football dribbling, swing ball, space hopping and, of course, TikTok-ing!People can still sponsor Mary by going to uk.virginmoneygiving marysfunrelay

title: world-cup-draw-channel-time-watch-play-off-draw-today
story: Scotland isseeded for the semi finals of the play-offs, thanks to an impressive win over Denmark in their final Group F match.Steve Clarkes side joins Wales, Italy,Portugal,Russia and Sweden in the seeded spots, with these teams set to face one ofAustria, North Macedonia, Turkey, Poland, Ukraine or Czech Republic.With the play-offs scheduled for March , this afternoons draw will give us an idea of whats to come for the Scotland team as they try to move one step closer to World Cup qualication.Heres what you need to know about this afternoons World Cup play offdraw, including time and how to watch...The World Cup play offdraw will take place in Zurich, Switzerland at the Fa headquarterson Friday November  at pm UK time.The World Cup play off draw can be livestreamed on Fas official websitethisafternoon.Coverage will start at pm.The World Cup play offs are set to take place in March .The twelve teams in the draw will be ided into three groups to play semis and finals.Semi final matches will be played on March - , and finals on March - .The three winners of these finals will then qualy for the World Cup.Scotland, Portugal, Italy, Russia, Sweden and Wales are all seeded for the World Cup play offs.Scotland and the other seeded sides could be drawn against any of the following teams:The  World Cup will start on November  , with the final taking place on December  .This is later in the year than usual due to extremely high temperatures in Doha in the summer.

title: christmas-gifts-sale-craft-fair
story: The Fraser Centre is hosting the event on Saturday, December , with a number of dferent stalls selling Christmas gts.A raffle to win a two-course lunch for two or an afternoon tea package will also be held.The craft fair takes place from am to pm at the venue on Tranentrsquos Winton Place.

title: tapestry-group-reaching-nationwide-stitchers
story: This follows research carried out by Dr David Caldwell, president of the Society of Antiquaries of Scotland, who worked for  years with the National Museums of Scotland.He has studied the list of names of Scottish soldiers who died, which is read out at the Old Musselburgh Clubrsquos annual commemoration of the battle at its memorial stone near Wallyford.The revised list has some  names it is hoped MSPs will be enlisted to share them with groups and organisations in their communities to give them the chance to research their ancestors.Roger Knox, chairman of the Pinkie Cleugh Battlefield Group, said: ldquoThe names of the fallen at Pinkie, uncovered by David Caldwell, illustrate the wide area of the origin of the force.ldquoExperience of other tapestry constructions has shown that people do show an interest where there is a connection to their own village, estate, family and area.ldquoWe hope that the circulation of the names and places of origin of the fallen will encourage potential stitchers to come forward.Mr Knox said that Colin Beattie, MSP for Midlothian North and Musselburgh, had offered to circulate details amongst colleagues at the Scottish Parliament.Mr Beattie said: ldquoI am delighted to help in this signicant effort and have reached out to my colleagues in Holyrood to ask them to assist using their contacts with local quilting groups.ldquoI am pleased that I have already received several responses and hope that we can establish interest across Scotland to take part in this fantastic project.Designed by Andrew Crummy, the artist behind the Great Tapestry of Scotland and Battle of Prestonpans Tapestry, the Battle of Pinkie Cleugh Tapestry is being worked on by a group of stitchers under the expert guidance of Liz Neilson.Unlike any of Mr Crummyrsquos other tapestries, the Battle of Pinkie Cleugh Tapestry will have up to six huge .Stitchers have been working on smaller embroideries depicting their favourite parts of Musselburgh and what the town means to them.These will be incorporated into the finished , which will be housed at the Brunton Hall.Pinkie Cleugh was the last pitched battle between Scotland and England, fought on September , .It took place during the Rough Wooing, when the armies of Scotland and England fought to determine who should marry the infant Mary, Queen of Scots.The armies were led by the Earl of Arran, Regent of Scotland, and the Lord Protector of England, the Duke of Somerset, whose aim was to secure the betrothal of nine-year-old Prince Edward, the English heir apparent, to five-year-old Mary.There were , Scottish troops massacred in the rout, which became known as lsquoBlack Saturdayrsquo.Historic Environment Scotland is also reviewing the inventory record for the Battle of Pinkie and would welcome comments from the public.The battle was added to the list of nationally important battlefields in Scotland in .A spokesperson for Historic Environment Scotland said: ldquoWe have updated the inventory record for the Battle of Pinkie battlefield site following a request from a member of the public.ldquoThe record has been updated to reflect new research on the historical information and context of the battle.ldquoWe have added dferent interpretations of features connected to the battle and have updated the maps that accompany the record.ldquoThe Battle of Pinkie, which took place in , is thought to be the largest single battle ever fought in Scotland in terms of numbers of combatants.ldquoAs part of our consultation, which runs until Wednesday, December , we are encouraging members of the public to share their views on the proposed updates to the inventory at consultations.his toricenvironment.scot herit age battle-of-pinkieChanges were made to address the reasons why the Duke of Somerset invaded and the wider aims of the  campaign.Updated information regarding armoury and deployment numbers for the English forces has been included.

title: zans-wildlife-diary-redwing-winter-visitor
story: If you step outside on a calm autumn evening after the local birds have gone quiet, you may hear thin, plaintive whistles from overhead, which mark the arrival of redwings.Redwings are highly sociable ndash it is not uncommon to see them in flocks of hundreds as they roam throughout the country.Their main diet is berries and they seem to display a preference for some types over others it is believed that this is based on the softness and sweetness of the berries.In mild winters you are likely to see large flocks of redwings feasting on their favourites of hawthorns and rowans however, in harsh months they may forage for fruit in gardens or urban areas.Once disturbed, the birds will take off and seek refuge in neighbouring trees or hedges. Alongside eating berries, they also feed on small insects and mealworms.Unlike other members of the thrush family which build nests in the trees, redwings prefer to build their cup-shaped nests on the ground.The nest is usually well hidden in the dense vegetation and made out of grass, mosses and twigs.Most redwings breed in Scandinavia and Iceland, with a small number breeding in the UK, most of which are concentrated in the Scottish Highlands. The population arriving here from Iceland appears slightly darker and bigger and it is treated as the distinct subspecies coburni.Unlike many migratory birds, which remain loyal to their wintering grounds, redwings present a nomadic lestyle ndash driven by food availability, they rarelyto the same place.I have already seen my first redwings in Edinburgh but I am yet to find them in East Lothian this autumn.Last winter in Musselburgh was fabulous! I particularly remember the snowfall in January during a couple of days I took off work. I liked every minute and, despite cold hands and feet, I enjoyed walking along the Esk.At one point, I spotted a buzzard perching on a snowy branchand headed towards it.As soon as I captured the bird of prey, I heard a familiar lsquotseeprsquo call coming from the hedges.I knew the redwings must have been having a lavish meal as the call was getting louder with every step I took, but I could not see them.It amazes me how dficult it is to spot these birds, even though they are medium-sized and always in large groups.I managed to sneak inside the bush and, when I looked up, I saw at least  redwings. The birds were incredibly noisy and constantly on the move. The whole bush was bustling and I felt like I was sitting at the heart of a busy factory!Until now, I found that experience one of the most challenging. It was not easy to operate the camera in such a tight space, with twigs scratching my face the entire time. I did not have a clear view of the birds either, but I could not move as it would spook them!The low winter sun was already disappearing but, eventually, I did manage to find a gap and push the camera through. After taking a few photographs, I decided to head back home.When I ed to the same spot the following day, the redwings were gone.If you have enjoyed my pictures this year and would like to see more, I now have several designs of my WildleCalendars for sale. Please get in touch for more details.zanslenswww.facebook zanslenswww zans_lens

title: waitrose-announces-600-products-available-two-east-lothian-stores
story: More than  Waitrose products are now available in Margiottarsquos  shops, including in Aberlady andGullane.Ready meals, free-from and vegan ranges, prepared fruit and vegetables, meat, snacks and store cupboard staples are now available, as well as flowers and seasonal foods, which will include selection from the Waitrose Christmas range.Edinburgh-based Margiotta opened their first East Lothian store in Aberlady last spring before a second branch opened its doors in Gullane in June this year.Franco Margiotta, managing director of Margiotta Food  Wine, was pleased with the partnership, with Waitrose products appearing in the two East Lothian stores from yesterday .He said: ldquoWe are delighted to be stocking Waitrose food and drinks in our stores not only because of the quality of the products but also because of the new and increased range that we can now offer.ldquoWe have always strived to bring the best food products for our customers to enjoy and I am sure that they will be equally delighted in our partnership with Waitrose.

title: well-known-brass-band-finds-new-home
story: Dalkeith and Monktonhall Brass Band was founded in  by the amalgamation of Dalkeith Burgh Silver Band and Monktonhall Colliery Silver Band, following the closures of both pits.The band worked closely with East Lothian Council officials and councillors during lockdown to secure the use of the top flat of the Red School Youth Centre on Kirk Street.This will now be the musical teamrsquos headquarters, where they will rehearse on Mondays and Thursdays from .pm to .pm.Following months of weekly Zoom quizzes and virtual recordings, the band began gathering together for small outdoor rehearsals in May.They delivered their first major public performance at Edinburghrsquos Prestonfield House Hotel Princersquos Trust event in September and look forward to playing their first full concert at Morningside Parish Church on Saturday at .pm.Heather Henderson, band secretary, said: ldquoThis has been a long and hard period with no performance income or group contact for months.ldquoWersquove relied on playersrsquo subscriptions, donations and grants awards to get us through financially.ldquoGetting the band back together since May has been a fantastic experience for us and, combined with the new premises, sets us up for bigger and better things as we now reopen our learnersrsquo classes and start to focus back on taking part in major concerts and contests.Jim Chamberlain, the bandrsquos musical director added: ldquoItrsquos been a great team effort to keep everyone together and engaged during the long lockdown months.ldquoThe band has responded to the challenge of getting back together, rehearsing through the ious pandemic restrictions and then moving into the new premises.ldquoWersquore getting back to full musical strength now and look forward to getting back into our local communities.The band also offers low-cost instrumental and music tuition, as well as performance opportunities for existing and experienced players.For more information, contact Heather at secretarydmbrass@gmail

title: man-sentenced-pay-250-pushed-man-wall
story: Jordan Brown, , pushed David Hillhouse against a wall during the assault at Countess Road in Dunbar.Brown then seized Mr Hillhouse by the neck on January .Brown, of Davidson Terrace, admitted the attack during an appearance at Edinburgh Sherf Court last Friday.Sherf Daniel Kelly ordered Brown to pay the fine to mark the offence.

title: professional-chef-11-year-old-among-winners-county-menu-competition
story: The Great East Lothian Menu celebrated the high-quality food and drink produced locally in the county. Winners of the competition were announced on November .The competition judges were Peter Eccles, rsquos Farmer of the Year and co-founder of Lothian Larder at Saughland Farm, Pathhead Kylie Reid, founder of online community Egg and David Jamieson, executive chef at Archerfield and East Lothianrsquos food tourism ambassador.Brenda Pryde, from The Strawberry Barn, Dunbar, was named East Lothian Food and Drink Great East Lothian Menu Professional Chef of the Year.Brenda won for her cappuccino semreddo with Italian meringue, served under a candy floss cloud, with strawberry fraisier macarons, mango and passionfruit pacircteacute de fruit sugar cube, tuile biscuit spoon and chocolate coffee bean.The chef used ingredients from The Brand Family Larder, Fraiser of Scotland, Mungoswells, Yester Farm Dairies, Chocolate Tree, Brodies and The Strawberry Barn.The judges said that her dish demonstrated ldquohuge technique and stood out as something dferent the stunning presentation caught everyonersquos eye, and beyond everything , everyone was desperate to taste it.Judge Kylie added: ldquoBrenda Prydersquos skill and stunning presentation caught all of our eyes and had us desperate to taste it.In the professional category, chef Kate Lewis, from Lewis  Clarke, in Gford, was highly commended for her pork belly, scallops and sweetcorn.The Home Cook of the Year award went to Fiona Pollock for her lamb merguez-stuffed pumpkins, using ingredients from The Brand Family Larder and Kilduff Farm.Judges were ldquodelighted to see the sustainable use of pumpkins, which often get thrown away after Hallowersquoen.Fiona will receive a pound East Lothian gt card and a Commichef casserole dish, donated by Gibsons of Haddington.Highly commended was -year-old Maisie Gordon, from Humbie, for her beef tandoori masala burger with coleslaw.Judge David was so impressed by Maisiersquos dish that he invited her to visit him for afternoon tea and spend time with him in the kitchen.The judges were excited to see a young person so engaged with where her food came from that they awarded her pound.David said: ldquoI was intrigued to see how our competitors would combine their flavours andthey had taken any risks with their combinations.Peter added: ldquoWhat stood out to me was that the entries really used the local produce they took quality ingredients and enhanced them and ultimately came up with dishes that I would happily eat any day of the week.Emma Bouglet, business manager at organisers East Lothian Food and Drink, said: ldquoThank you to all those who submitted dishes in the first ever Great East Lothian Menu.ldquoWe are incredibly inspired by the flavour combinations and innovation displayed by you all.ldquoIt just goes to show the endless possibilities our producers provide us with.

title: santa-beach-run-returns-north-berwick-family-fun-event
story: The whistle will blow for attendees to get running at the townrsquos annual Santa Beach Run on December  at am.The event boasts a k, k and k run along the coastline, open to runners of all abilities ndash but participants should dress festively.Organised by Cath Brookes and Saartje Drijver and hosted by East Lothian Triathlon, the event will raise funds for Movement On The Ground, an organisation that supports refugees.All three races will start on the beach near Elcho Green and will stretch along the beach to the west of North Berwick and back, which may involve some wet feet and rocky routes, so appropriate shoes and clothes are advised.The k race is open to all ages, though children under seven who take part must be accompanied by an adult.The k run is open to anyone over the age of , and the k is open to those over .Entry for children up to the age of  is pound for adults it is pound ndash members of scottishathletics will be offered a pound discount.The event organisers have followed the scottishathletics guidance to take account of the impact of Covid-.For more information on the event, contact the organisers via wetwaterfamily@gmail

title: cold-weather-payments-postcode-checker---eligible
story: Snow and ice are forecast for areas of Scotland in the coming days, meaning more wintery temperatures could be on their way.With that in mind, heres everything you need to know about who is eligible and how to checkyour postcode should receive a pay out...The Cold Weather Payments are available the average temperature in your area is recorded as, or forecast to be, zero degrees celsius or below over  days in a row.You canget pound for each  day period of very cold weather betweenNovember   and March  .To receivethe cold weather payments, you must be receiving certain benefits.You may get Cold Weather Paymentsyoursquore getting:Additionally, you must meet at least one of the following criteria:No -you are eligible for the Cold Weather Payments you will be automatically paid and do not need to apply.However,you think you should have received a payment but havent, you should tell thePension ServiceorJobcentre Plus.Alternatively, you should add a note to your Universal Credit online journal orring the Universal Credit helpline.You can check your postcode for the Cold Weather Payments on the governments postcode checker which can be found here.Simply enter your postcode to find out how many payments your area is eligible for betweenNovember   and March .Payments are only available when there has been -days in a row of temperatures or forecast temperatures below  degrees.

title: hibs-star-joe-newell-admits-drink-driving-charge
story: Newell, appearing under his full name of Joseph Newell, was caught more than three times the legal drink drive limit when police pulled him over in October.The -year-old Hibs playmaker was taken to a local police station and cautioned and charged with the offence.Fiscal depute Drew Long told Edinburgh Sherf Court officers on mobile patrol spotted Newell driving ldquoparticularly slowly near to his home in Wallyford at about .am on October  this year.Mr Long told todayscourt hearing that ldquothe vehicle was stopped and Newell was identied as the driver.The court heard Newell undertook two breath tests and the lower reading of mg of alcohol in ml of breath was given.The legal limit is just mg.Solicitor Peter Malone, defending, said his client had a previous unblemished driving record and had been on the road since he was  years old.Mr Malone said Newell ldquoregrets getting into the car after consuming alcohol and that he ldquofully appreciates the seriousness of the matter.The lawyer added: ldquoHe assures me there will be no repeat.Sherf Alistair Noble banned the Hibs star from driving for  months and fined him a total of pound.The sherf also allowed Newell to take part in a drink drive rehabilitation scheme wherebyhe passes the course successfully the road ban will be reduced by three months.Newell pleaded guilty to driving with mg of alcohol in ml of breath at the A road at Wallyford, East Lothian, on October  this year.Newell is expected to play for Hibernian against league leaders Rangers in a crunch SPFL match at Easter Road tonight.The English midfielder signed for the capital club in  and extended his contract for a further two years in February this year.

title: msp-accuses-bus-bosses-heads-sand-suspended-x5-service
story: Craig Hoy, Conservative South Scotland MSP, claims he contacted Lothian Buses three times to organise a meeting to discuss the future of the service, before he received a response.The X bus was suspended last year by East Coast Buses, a subsidiary of Lothian Buses, following the introduction of national lockdown restrictions.The service ran through North Berwick, Dirleton, Gullane, Aberlady and Longniddry, then directly to Edinburgh via the A.Commuters from Dirleton, Gullane and Aberlady now face an extra hour in their daily commute to Edinburgh using the  bus service, which stops at Prestonpans, Wallyford, Musselburgh and Portobello.An online petition launched by Mr Hoy calling for the reinstatement of the service has now received more than  signatures.Mr Hoy said: ldquoIn early October, my office contacted East Coast Buses, who issued a standard response outlining the reasons for continued withdrawal of the service, including challenges with recruitment, the need to prioritise key services and the focus on delivering the  service.ldquoI recognise these challenges, but I also recognise they apply across all routes across the whole of the Lothians and are not confined to the X route.ldquoAfter a number of residents living in Dirleton, Gullane, Aberlady and Longniddry reached out to me about the X bus, I launched a petition calling for the reinstatement of the service.ldquoI wrote to East Coast Buses on two occasions requesting a face-to-face meeting, and followed this up with a third letter to the interim managing director of Lothian Buses.ldquoLothian Buses is owned by the four Lothian council areas, which includes East Lothian Council. That makes it accountable to the residents of our community.ldquoThe number of signatures on the petition shows the clear strength of feeling in the area about reinstating the X bus.ldquoAt this point, Lothian Buses have their heads buried in the sand ndash they cannot keep ignoring our communities.In a letter to Mr Hoy dated November , Nigel Serafini, interim managing director of Lothian Buses, said it was the companyrsquos ldquopriority to re-establish the X ldquoas soon as driver resource permits.He added: ldquoThe X covers no additional areas that service  does not .ldquoIn contrast, the X is the only service that operates to East Linton, West Barns and Dunbar. Without the X these communities would be without a regular bus service whilst, as explained, the same is not true of Gullane, Aberlady and Dirleton.A spokesperson for East Coast Buses added: ldquoEast Coast Buses is absolutely committed to delivering for all of our customers in East Lothian.ldquoLike many other transport providers at this time, we are in an extremely challenging recruitment market, which, coupled with our safety protocols for colleagues who find themselves in the Covid- track and trace cycle, means that we are experiencing signicant resourcing dficulties in our driving team on a day-to-day basis.ldquoWith limited available resource, we have made the dficult decision to prioritise key services which provide as many transport links as possible throughout East Lothian. In terms of service provision for Gullane and Aberlady, we have focused on delivering service , which provides critical local links along the coast as well as direct travel to Edinburgh.

title: fate-rail-underpass-depends-new-housing-scheme-decision-dunbar
story: Hundreds of new homes have been built at Hallhill, south of the railway line, in Dunbar in recent years.However, pedestrian links between the new homes and the older section of Dunbar are limited.East Lothian Council is keen to see a new pedestrian underpass to improve connections, which could be financed in part through another housing development in the area.It is expected that the cost of the underpass would be more than pound million, with part of the cost being covered by the Hallhill North development, which would consist of  houses and  flats.A decision is set to be made on the plans, which come from Taylor Wimpey East Scotland and Hallhill Developments Limited, at a meeting of East Lothian Councilrsquos planning committee on Tuesday.Councillor Norman Hampshire, who chairs the local authorityrsquos planning committee and represents Dunbar on East Lothian Council, noted that currently the only pedestrian access in the area was under the railway line beside Hallhill Sports Centre.He said: ldquoAs part of the application, the developer will be making a contribution to a new underpass at the railway.ldquoThere will not be enough funding coming from the developer to completely do this underpass.ldquoThat has to be done through grant funding from other agencies and the council themselves.ldquoAt the moment, all the houses from the Hallhill area to get to both the lower primary school and secondary school have to come underneath the tunnel, and children going to the Lochend Campus have to come back through that one.ldquoIt is really congested and we definitely need another way through there.An underpass was previously in place under the railway line but it was blocked up a number of years ago.Network Rail was approached about seeing it reopened but was not keen on the idea and East Lothian Council would have been liable for the structure.Mr Hampshire said: ldquoWe have to go with a completely new cut-through for pedestrians and cyclists, which will come through into Ash Grove swing park area but will be a safe route to get to the secondary school.Drawings and documents for the planning application were first submitted to East Lothian Councilrsquos planning department at the beginning of February last year.The scheme, to the west of the primary schoolrsquos Lochend Campus, originally featured  houses and  apartments.

title: storyteller-tim-porteus-standing-greens-preston-seton-gosford-by-election
story: The -year-old, from Prestonpans, will also stand for the party in the ward at the full East Lothian Council elections next May.The early years charity worker ndash who writes the weekly Timrsquos Tales column for the Courier ndash works in Midlothian assisting children and families, and lives with his we Kate and three youngest children.Mr Porteus said: ldquoI am standing because I believe my community has amazing assets in its people and beautul natural setting, but we also have our issues that need to be addressed.ldquoI am passionate about education and childrenrsquos wellbeing but, here in East Lothian, we see signicant local issues around education provision and opportunities for our young people.ldquoThey have also been very adversely affected by Covid restrictions. While these restrictions have been necessary in keeping people safe, they have had deep-seated implications for our community.ldquoEradicating poverty has to be a central focus in all this. We can only do this by making decisions based on the principles of social justice and creating a sustainable circular economy that works for everyone.ldquoI believe that the Scottish Greens will be a chance for the people of this amazing ward to show their support for taking a new approach to tackling the problems we face, and making the most of the benefits of our wonderful part of the world.Tim has pledged to campaign on better education provision and services for families, as well as supporting the Cockenzie  Project at the former power station site, which he believes would create long -term jobs and learning opportunities, and have a hugely positive impact on the environment.Simon Francis, co-convenor of East Lothian Greens, added: ldquoTim will make an amazing councillor for an area he lives and breathes. His experience working on the frontline with children and families will ensure he brings much-needed real world insight into the decision-making of the council.ldquoI would urge everyone to vote for Tim and trust him to serve the community he loves.A by-election is taking place in the Preston Seton Gosford ward on Thursday, January , following the death of Councillor Willie Innes in October.Mr Porteus is the third candidate so far announced for the by-election, joining Calum Millerand Colin Yorkston .

title: knox-academy-pupils-staff-give-views-school-bell-trial
story: Bells at the Haddington secondary school were silenced at the beginning of last month ndash other than marking the start of the day, end of break, lunch and end of the day.The move was made amid claims it would encourage better time management and a reduction in anxiety for youngsters with additional support needs.Speaking on Friday, Sue Cook, headteacher at the school, said: ldquoA survey has been sent to all pupils and staff for their views on whether this is retained or not.ldquoThe survey closes at midday today and pupils, staff and parents carers will be notied of any changes next week.ldquoIf we do revert to bells at the end of each period, this would not take effect until Monday.

title: festive-themed-north-berwick-post-boxes-looking-tops
story: Two red Royal Mail post boxes are sporting Christmas-themed bonnets thanks to the painstaking efforts of two town residents.Community council chairman Judy Lockhart-Hunter and friend Linda Digney spent many hours making the crocheted post box toppers after being inspired by similar creations in other parts of the country.Said Judy: "We hoped that we could bring a smile to people and raise some money for the Christmas lights."When we were putting them up quite a few people came over to see what we were doing and the toppers seemed to really make everyone smile."They are a lot of work to make: they took us many many hours over quite a few months, not to mention the sore hands!"We want to keep them going in the future but will probably only do them for Christmas because of the amount of work."We werent  per cent sure they would even fit but we are both so proud of them and thrilled to see that so many people are getting enjoyment from them."The decorated post boxes can be found on the towns Quality Street and on St Baldreds Road.Meanwhile, there is late-night Christmas shopping in North Berwick this evening and in a fortnights time.Local businesses in the town will open until pm tonightand December  to allow shoppers more time to purchase gts, with extra festivities provided by North Berwick in Bloom and Christmas carols by North Berwick Gospel Choir.North Berwick in Bloom will serve warm winter punch to get visitors in the festive mood.To donate to the towns Christmas lights fund, go to: GoFundMe nbchristmaslights

title: gifford-set-switch-christmas-lights
story: Village residents come together tomorrowfor the switch-on of the Christmas lights.Debbie Mercer, acting headteacher at Yester Primary School, has the honour of switching on the lights at pm.Businesses throughout the village are also doing their bit from serving mulled wine to offering discounts.From December  to  is the traditional Christmas post before a carol service takes place round the villagersquos Christmas tree on December .

title: kevin-bridges-tour-2022-uk---full-list-dates-get-tickets-presale
story: The Scottish comedian will play six dates at the Glasgow Hydroas well as PJ Live inAberdeenand other venues around the UK.Making the announcement on his Facebook page of Friday morning, he said said: "Folkshellip The Overdue Catch-Up goes on sale next Friday,  December am." to my mailing list at www.kevinbridges for access to the presale on Wednesday,  December from am."Irsquoll see you about.
